cursor.description: Used for pagination.  When a list request has more records available, cursors are provided in the response headers `X-Files-Cursor-Next` and `X-Files-Cursor-Prev`.  Send one of those cursor value here to resume an existing list from the next available record.  Note: many of our SDKs have iterator methods that will automatically handle cursor-based pagination.

per_page.description: Number of records to show per page.  (Max: 10,000, 1,000 or less is recommended).

sort_by.description: If set, sort records by the specified field in either `asc` or `desc` direction (e.g. `sort_by[name]=desc`). Valid fields are `name`.

filter.description: If set, return records where the specified field is equal to the supplied value. Valid fields are `name`.

filter_prefix.description: If set, return records where the specified field is prefixed by the supplied value. Valid fields are `name`.

ids.description: Comma-separated list of group ids to include in results.

$ul: **admin_ids**: Comma-delimited list of user IDs who are group administrators (separated by commas)
**user_ids**: Comma-delimited list of user IDs who belong to this group (separated by commas)
**usernames**: Comma-delimited list of usernames who belong to this group (separated by commas)
